brief_summary.textblock:
The anatomic landmark for the anteroposterior (AP) axis of the proximal tibia and its
      variability was investigated in this study in order to determine whether a certain landmark
      could be employed as a reference axis for the proximal tibia after rotating platform mobile
      bearing (RP-MB) and fixed bearing (FB) total knee arthroplasties (TKAs).

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of the Tibiofemoral Rotational Alignment After Mobile and Fixed Bearing Total Knee Arthroplasty

detailed_description.textblock:
Reference of tibial AP axis for implanting tibial component in total knee arthroplasty have
      not been concluded. This study can suggest appropriate method for alingning the tibial
      component to accurate tibial AP axis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Primary osteoarthritis

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  infection

          -  inflammatory arthritis

          -  reoperation

          -  severe deformity

intervention.other_name: Sigma® RP-F Knee System, Depuy J&J, Warsaw, IN, USA
Nexgen® Legacy® Knee LPS-Flex, Zimmer, Warsaw, IN, USA

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Tibiofemoral Rotational Alignment After Mobile and Fixed Bearing Total Knee Arthroplasty

primary_outcome.description: Tibial anteroposterior axis relative to femoral anteroposterior axis on Computed tomogram images
primary_outcome.measure: Tibial anteroposterior axis relative to femoral anteroposterior axis
